The UAE Is Redefining Global Education InvestmentA massive move caught my attention: Mubadala and Dubai Holding joined forces with a global group to acquire Nord Anglia Education in a $14.5B deal one of the biggest education acquisitions ever.This isn’t just business. It’s a bold message: the hashtag#UAE isn’t just focusing on local education reform; it’s shaping how the world learns.Why does this matter? •	Mubadala’s $600M equity stake reflects a national strategy to invest in human capital and align with the UAE’s AI and innovation goals. •	Dubai Holding’s involvement shows how deeply education ties into the UAE’s positioning as a global hub for talent, families, and future industries. •	Nord Anglia isn’t just any operator 85,000+ students, 80+ schools in 33 countries, and partnerships with MIT, Juilliard, and UNICEF.The local context is just as powerful: •	827 international schools make the UAE #1 globally per capita. •	220+ of those are in Dubai alone. •	The UAE’s private K-12 market is projected to hit $7.1B by 2027. •	Education remains one of the largest priorities in the federal budget.This deal isn’t just about returns it’s about long term influence, future proofing our youth, and making the UAE a reference point for educational excellence worldwide.Smart nations build roads. Visionary ones build minds. 🇦🇪

Username: Jonathan Burns جونثان برنزJonathan Burns جونثان برنز
Post Content:
🌍 KSA’s New UBO Disclosure Rules – Initial Observations 🌍 The new Ultimate Beneficial Ownership (UBO) disclosure rules of the Ministry of Commerce have now been in effect in Saudi Arabia for two weeks. Based on early experience, here are some key features—and notable sticking points—of the framework:WHO IS SUBJECT TO THE OBLIGATION?👉 Only legal entities incorporated in KSA are required to comply. In practice, the entity will have a dedicated page within its government e-portal account to satisfy the UBO disclosure.👉 Important to note: Technically, the disclosure obligation does not extend to shareholders, foreign parent companies, or shell entities in the corporate chain. The responsibility lies with the KSA subsidiary.WHAT TRIGGERS A DISCLOSURE OBLIGATION?UBO disclosure obligations can be triggered objectively and subjectively: 1️⃣  Objectively, the obligation is triggered by having, directly or indirectly:  ▪️ ≥25% shareholding or voting rights in a KSA legal entity, and/or  ▪️ the power to appoint or dismiss a KSA legal entity’s manager, the majority of its board members, or its chairperson. 2️⃣ Subjectively, the obligation is triggered by having, directly or indirectly, the ability to “influence” a KSA legal entity’s operations or decisions.⚠️ Sticking point: “Influence” is not defined in the rules, leaving room for interpretation and potential compliance risk.WHO TRIGGERS THE OBLIGATION?👉 Natural persons meeting the above thresholds must be identified. HOWEVER, for corporate entities in the ownership chain meeting any of the above triggers, Article 4.1.e. requires the disclosure of a “legal representative”—even up through multiple levels.⚠️ Sticking point: “Legal representative” is also undefined and may vary depending on the jurisdiction of incorporation.WHEN MUST DISCLOSURE OCCUR?▪️ At incorporation for new entities▪️ By the next commercial register anniversary for existing entities⚠️ Sticking point: There is no grace period, meaning entities nearing their anniversary may face an urgent compliance timeline.📝 Looking ahead...Article 7.3 of the Rules provides that the Ministry will issue a detailed Guide, which should clarify these ambiguities. As of today, that guidance has not yet been released.This summary reflects general observations to date. There are exclusions, exceptions, and additional complexities not addressed here.hashtag#SaudiArabia hashtag#CorporateLaw hashtag#UBO hashtag#Compliance hashtag#RegulatoryUpdates hashtag#KSA hashtag#BusinessLaw hashtag#CorporateGovernance hashtag#MiddleEastLaw hashtag#LegalUpdates hashtag#MinistryOfCommerce hashtag#KSACompliance hashtag#BeneficialOwnership

UAE Doubles Down on Global Education: $14.5B Deal with Nord Anglia Education Signals New Era in Talent Investment In April 2025, Mubadala Investment Company and Dubai Holding joined a global consortium to acquire Nord Anglia Education a premium international schools operator in a $14.5 billion megadeal, one of the largest education-focused acquisitions in history.The UAE is no longer just educating its youth it’s investing in how the world learns.Who’s Involved in the $14.5B Consortium?1. EQT Group – Europe’s largest PE firm 2. Neuberger Berman 3. Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPP Investments)4. Corporación Financiera Alba5. Mubadala Investment Company – $600M stake (confirmed)6. Dubai Holding – strategic investor (amount undisclosed)Why Mubadala Made This InvestmentMubadala’s $600M equity stake is not just capital deployment it’s part of a national capability strategy:1. Human Capital First: Mubadala aligns with the UAE’s vision that education is the cornerstone of national prosperity.2. Future Workforce Fit: Nord Anglia’s AI, STEAM, and leadership programs are aligned with UAE’s AI Strategy 2031 and Fourth Industrial Revolution goals.3. Global Returns, Local Impact: Investing in a global operator helps bring best practices to the UAE and generate returns that diversify away from oil.Why Dubai Holding Joined the DealDubai Holding’s participation is deeply strategic it goes beyond finance and reflects a long-term vision:1. City Branding: Dubai aims to be the #1 global city for living, working, and raising families. World-class education is central to that.2. Direct Ecosystem Benefit: Nord Anglia already operates two leading schools in Dubai. This investment strengthens Dubai’s appeal to global talent and companies.3. Soft Power Diplomacy: Enhancing Dubai’s presence in global education circles elevates its cultural and institutional reputation.Why Nord Anglia?1. 85,000+ students | 80+ campuses | 33 countries2. Over 50% of students enter Top 100 QS-ranked universities3. Strategic partnerships with MIT, Juilliard, UNICEF4. AI, coding, entrepreneurship integrated from early stages5. Flagships in: Dubai, Abu Dhabi, New York, Dublin, Hong Kong, GenevaThe UAE’s Local Education Ecosystem:1. 827 international schools the largest per capita globally2. AED 26B ($7.1B): Projected UAE private K-12 market by 2027 3. 220+ international schools in Dubai alone4. 60,000+ new student seats added in 2 years5. 35% of UAE population is under 256. 89% expat population requires premium education options7. 40% of UAE’s federal budget (2025) allocated to social development education is the top priorityThis investment future-proofs the economy, drives educational reform, and expands the nation’s global influence in shaping knowledge ecosystems.This is how visionary nations invest not just in infrastructure but in intellect.

A Dubai-based developer called me in a panic.They were finalizing a luxury residential sale — but their VAT refund worth AED 58,000 had been stuck for months.Here’s what happened: → They missed the filing deadline for Q3 → Filed Q4 late, without reconciling Q3 → FTA flagged both and paused refund processing → Meanwhile, cash flow was blocked — delaying their payment to a contractorTotal cost: → AED 4,000 in late fines → AED 58,000 refund delayed → AED 400K project payment stuck for 3 weeks📌 Late filings aren’t just a fine — they block cash, refunds, and deals.What we did: → Filed voluntary disclosures for both quarters → Reconciled past returns and cleared documentation gaps → Recovered the refund in 29 days💬 DM me “VAT Fix” if you’ve missed deadlines in the past 6 months — let’s prevent penalties before they pile up.hashtag#UAERealEstate hashtag#VATCompliance hashtag#FTA hashtag#CashFlow

🩺  Unlocking Healthcare Excellence in the Middle East: Top Destinations, Leading Doctors, and the Road Ahead (part 1)As the Middle East continues its rapid transformation, one sector rising to the forefront is healthcare. Over the last decade, we’ve witnessed an incredible evolution- not just in infrastructure but in innovation, specialization, and global reputation. Countries across the region are now competing not only to serve their local populations but also to become global hubs for medical tourism.Here’s a look at where things stand, who’s leading the charge, and what opportunities lie ahead.🏥 Top Healthcare Destinations in the Middle East1. IranOften underrepresented in international rankings due to geopolitical factors, Iran is in fact one of the most advanced medical ecosystems in the region. With a high density of top-tier specialists, state-of-the-art surgical centers, and remarkably affordable pricing, Iran has become a go-to destination for patients from neighboring countries, Central Asia, and even Europe. From oncology and transplant surgery to fertility and reconstructive procedures, Iranian doctors are not only highly skilled but also often pioneers in their fields. Cities like Tehran, Shiraz, Mashhad, and Isfahan host globally respected hospitals and research institutions.2. United Arab Emirates (UAE)Dubai and Abu Dhabi have positioned themselves as world-class medical tourism destinations. With internationally accredited hospitals like Cleveland Clinic Abu Dhabi and Dubai Healthcare City, the UAE is attracting patients from across the GCC, Africa, and beyond.3. Saudi Arabia As part of Vision 2030, Saudi Arabia is heavily investing in transforming its healthcare sector. Riyadh and Jeddah now host a growing number of specialized hospitals, and the Kingdom is actively pursuing public-private partnerships (PPPs) to fast-track innovation and infrastructure.4. QatarHome to Sidra Medicine and Hamad Medical Corporation, Qatar is building a reputation for excellence in pediatric and women's health, with a strong focus on research and academic partnerships.5. Jordan and LebanonKnown for decades as go-to destinations for affordable, high-quality care, particularly in cardiology, oncology, and cosmetic procedures. These countries remain key players, especially for patients from North Africa and the Levant.hashtag#Healthcare hashtag#MiddleEast hashtag#HealthTech hashtag#Investment hashtag#Innovation hashtag#DigitalHealth hashtag#Iran hashtag#UAE hashtag#Saudiarabia hashtag#Qatar hashtag#Jordan hashtag#Lebanon hashtag#doctor

Remember when setting up in a UAE Free Zone felt like unlocking a treasure chest of tax benefits? Well, the map has changed, and it's time to chart a new course.The UAE's new corporate tax regime is here, and while Free Zone businesses can still enjoy a 0% tax rate, it's not automatic. To qualify as a Qualifying Free Zone Person (QFZP), you need to meet specific criteria:✅ Key Requirements:• Qualifying Income: Earn income from transactions with other Free Zone entities or from defined qualifying activities.• Substance Requirements: Maintain adequate physical presence and operations within the Free Zone.• De Minimis Rule: Ensure non-qualifying income doesn't exceed 5% of total revenue or AED 5 million, whichever is lower.• Audited Financials: Prepare and maintain audited financial statements in accordance with IFRS.⚠ Consequences of Non-Compliance: Failing to meet these conditions means losing QFZP status and being subject to the standard 9% corporate tax rate for at least five years.💡 Take Action Now: Review your business activities, ensure compliance with the new regulations, and consult with tax professionals to navigate this transition smoothly.hashtag#UAE hashtag#CorporateTax hashtag#FreeZone hashtag#BusinessStrategy hashtag#TaxCompliance hashtag#EconomicDiversification hashtag#TaxStrategy hashtag#QFZP hashtag#Brooksme

From 2009 to 2020, Espace brokers competed for some incredible prizes. Four Rolex watches in a single four month competition, boat parties, and multiple incentive trips to Las Vegas were just a few of the rewards up for grabs.Since COVID, as the Dubai property market has built strong momentum, industry incentives have ramped up once again. But while prizes and perks do play a role in motivation, they’re the easy part of the recipe and should be seen for what they are… the cherry on top.The real engine behind broker success isn’t gimmicks. It’s the strength of the platform they operate in. At Espace, everything is built around one core focus: creating a marketplace that gives brokers the highest possible chance to perform at their best and deliver exceptional revenue.While anyone can compete in the incentives game, it’s not a level playing field when it comes to the strength of the marketplace itself, and that’s where the real difference is made.hashtag#espacerealestate hashtag#dubai hashtag#mydubai hashtag#dubaibrokers hashtag#realestatedubai hashtag#dubairealestate hashtag#property hashtag#propertymarket

O Brasil tem avançado significativamente na modernização de sua infraestrutura aeroportuária. Nos últimos anos, a ampliação do modelo de concessões e os investimentos em eficiência operacional vêm transformando o setor, ampliando a conectividade regional e elevando a qualidade dos serviços prestados.Gerir aeroportos com eficiência envolve mais do que obras: requer planejamento integrado, controle rigoroso de custos, governança sólida e compromisso com metas de desempenho e sustentabilidade.É nesse contexto que a combinação entre expertise global e conhecimento local se torna essencial. IPS Dubai was full of energy, innovation, and exciting real estate opportunities.As an architect who always steps into the client’s shoes, I couldn’t help but imagine how the visitor experience could have been more interactive, here is what came to mind :1. A clearer focus on what makes each project stand out would be inspiring.2. Interiors deserve as much spotlight as the beautiful façades.3. VR tech could elevate how people explore spaces.4. Pavilion layouts with more self-guided content could make discovery more intuitive—through interior models, videos, and visual storytelling.Personally, I thought Sustainable City 2.0 was a strong highlight, what I call an inspiring model for future developments. Yet, it felt a bit tech-heavy; a more interactive, human-centered experience could have made it the perfect blend for getting user engagement and interest.It was a great experience overall! and I’m excited to see how it evolves in the coming years!hashtag#IPSDubai hashtag#ArchitectureMatters hashtag#RealEstateInnovation hashtag#UserExperienceDesign hashtag#SustainableDesign hashtag#VRinRealEstate hashtag#InteriorDesignMatters hashtag#ArchitectPerspective hashtag#PropertyDevelopment

Renting vs Owning in Dubai – The Debate That Divides the SkylineLet’s break it once and for all:Renting a Property in DubaiPros: • No long-term commitment • Flexibility to move anytime • No maintenance headachesCons: • 100% money gone = 0 equity • Annual rent hikes • You’re paying someone else’s mortgageOwning a Property in DubaiPros: • Build equity over time • Stable payments (if mortgage) • Eligible for the Golden Visa (with AED 2M+ property) • Passive income through rental yieldsCons: • Initial down payment (usually 20–25%) • Long-term commitment • Market fluctuationsLet’s do the math:Paying AED 100,000/year in rent = AED 1 million burned in 10 years.Buy a property for AED 1.5M with 8% yield = AED 120,000/year income + value appreciation + Golden Visa.Now ask yourself:Do you want to rent your lifestyle or own your future?Because in Dubai, real estate isn’t just a transaction—it’s a transformation.Still confused? Let’s talk. I help people make life-changing moves every day.

The UAE Is Redefining Global Education InvestmentA massive move caught my attention: Mubadala and Dubai Holding joined forces with a global group to acquire Nord Anglia Education in a $14.5B deal one of the biggest education acquisitions ever.This isn’t just business. It’s a bold message: the hashtag#UAE isn’t just focusing on local education reform; it’s shaping how the world learns.Why does this matter? •	Mubadala’s $600M equity stake reflects a national strategy to invest in human capital and align with the UAE’s AI and innovation goals. •	Dubai Holding’s involvement shows how deeply education ties into the UAE’s positioning as a global hub for talent, families, and future industries. •	Nord Anglia isn’t just any operator 85,000+ students, 80+ schools in 33 countries, and partnerships with MIT, Juilliard, and UNICEF.The local context is just as powerful: •	827 international schools make the UAE #1 globally per capita. •	220+ of those are in Dubai alone. •	The UAE’s private K-12 market is projected to hit $7.1B by 2027. •	Education remains one of the largest priorities in the federal budget.This deal isn’t just about returns it’s about long term influence, future proofing our youth, and making the UAE a reference point for educational excellence worldwide.Smart nations build roads. Visionary ones build minds. 🇦🇪

Post Content:
🌍 KSA’s New UBO Disclosure Rules – Initial Observations 🌍 The new Ultimate Beneficial Ownership (UBO) disclosure rules of the Ministry of Commerce have now been in effect in Saudi Arabia for two weeks. Based on early experience, here are some key features—and notable sticking points—of the framework:WHO IS SUBJECT TO THE OBLIGATION?👉 Only legal entities incorporated in KSA are required to comply. In practice, the entity will have a dedicated page within its government e-portal account to satisfy the UBO disclosure.👉 Important to note: Technically, the disclosure obligation does not extend to shareholders, foreign parent companies, or shell entities in the corporate chain. The responsibility lies with the KSA subsidiary.WHAT TRIGGERS A DISCLOSURE OBLIGATION?UBO disclosure obligations can be triggered objectively and subjectively: 1️⃣  Objectively, the obligation is triggered by having, directly or indirectly:  ▪️ ≥25% shareholding or voting rights in a KSA legal entity, and/or  ▪️ the power to appoint or dismiss a KSA legal entity’s manager, the majority of its board members, or its chairperson. 2️⃣ Subjectively, the obligation is triggered by having, directly or indirectly, the ability to “influence” a KSA legal entity’s operations or decisions.⚠️ Sticking point: “Influence” is not defined in the rules, leaving room for interpretation and potential compliance risk.WHO TRIGGERS THE OBLIGATION?👉 Natural persons meeting the above thresholds must be identified. HOWEVER, for corporate entities in the ownership chain meeting any of the above triggers, Article 4.1.e. requires the disclosure of a “legal representative”—even up through multiple levels.⚠️ Sticking point: “Legal representative” is also undefined and may vary depending on the jurisdiction of incorporation.WHEN MUST DISCLOSURE OCCUR?▪️ At incorporation for new entities▪️ By the next commercial register anniversary for existing entities⚠️ Sticking point: There is no grace period, meaning entities nearing their anniversary may face an urgent compliance timeline.📝 Looking ahead...Article 7.3 of the Rules provides that the Ministry will issue a detailed Guide, which should clarify these ambiguities. As of today, that guidance has not yet been released.This summary reflects general observations to date. There are exclusions, exceptions, and additional complexities not addressed here.hashtag#SaudiArabia hashtag#CorporateLaw hashtag#UBO hashtag#Compliance hashtag#RegulatoryUpdates hashtag#KSA hashtag#BusinessLaw hashtag#CorporateGovernance hashtag#MiddleEastLaw hashtag#LegalUpdates hashtag#MinistryOfCommerce hashtag#KSACompliance hashtag#BeneficialOwnership

UAE Doubles Down on Global Education: $14.5B Deal with Nord Anglia Education Signals New Era in Talent Investment In April 2025, Mubadala Investment Company and Dubai Holding joined a global consortium to acquire Nord Anglia Education a premium international schools operator in a $14.5 billion megadeal, one of the largest education-focused acquisitions in history.The UAE is no longer just educating its youth it’s investing in how the world learns.Who’s Involved in the $14.5B Consortium?1. EQT Group – Europe’s largest PE firm 2. Neuberger Berman 3. Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPP Investments)4. Corporación Financiera Alba5. Mubadala Investment Company – $600M stake (confirmed)6. Dubai Holding – strategic investor (amount undisclosed)Why Mubadala Made This InvestmentMubadala’s $600M equity stake is not just capital deployment it’s part of a national capability strategy:1. Human Capital First: Mubadala aligns with the UAE’s vision that education is the cornerstone of national prosperity.2. Future Workforce Fit: Nord Anglia’s AI, STEAM, and leadership programs are aligned with UAE’s AI Strategy 2031 and Fourth Industrial Revolution goals.3. Global Returns, Local Impact: Investing in a global operator helps bring best practices to the UAE and generate returns that diversify away from oil.Why Dubai Holding Joined the DealDubai Holding’s participation is deeply strategic it goes beyond finance and reflects a long-term vision:1. City Branding: Dubai aims to be the #1 global city for living, working, and raising families. World-class education is central to that.2. Direct Ecosystem Benefit: Nord Anglia already operates two leading schools in Dubai. This investment strengthens Dubai’s appeal to global talent and companies.3. Soft Power Diplomacy: Enhancing Dubai’s presence in global education circles elevates its cultural and institutional reputation.Why Nord Anglia?1. 85,000+ students | 80+ campuses | 33 countries2. Over 50% of students enter Top 100 QS-ranked universities3. Strategic partnerships with MIT, Juilliard, UNICEF4. AI, coding, entrepreneurship integrated from early stages5. Flagships in: Dubai, Abu Dhabi, New York, Dublin, Hong Kong, GenevaThe UAE’s Local Education Ecosystem:1. 827 international schools the largest per capita globally2. AED 26B ($7.1B): Projected UAE private K-12 market by 2027 3. 220+ international schools in Dubai alone4. 60,000+ new student seats added in 2 years5. 35% of UAE population is under 256. 89% expat population requires premium education options7. 40% of UAE’s federal budget (2025) allocated to social development education is the top priorityThis investment future-proofs the economy, drives educational reform, and expands the nation’s global influence in shaping knowledge ecosystems.This is how visionary nations invest not just in infrastructure but in intellect.

A Dubai-based developer called me in a panic.They were finalizing a luxury residential sale — but their VAT refund worth AED 58,000 had been stuck for months.Here’s what happened: → They missed the filing deadline for Q3 → Filed Q4 late, without reconciling Q3 → FTA flagged both and paused refund processing → Meanwhile, cash flow was blocked — delaying their payment to a contractorTotal cost: → AED 4,000 in late fines → AED 58,000 refund delayed → AED 400K project payment stuck for 3 weeks📌 Late filings aren’t just a fine — they block cash, refunds, and deals.What we did: → Filed voluntary disclosures for both quarters → Reconciled past returns and cleared documentation gaps → Recovered the refund in 29 days💬 DM me “VAT Fix” if you’ve missed deadlines in the past 6 months — let’s prevent penalties before they pile up.hashtag#UAERealEstate hashtag#VATCompliance hashtag#FTA hashtag#CashFlow

Username: Dr. Maryam Fouladirad, DBA, MBA, CITP, ACMIDr. Maryam Fouladirad, DBA, MBA, CITP, ACMI
Post Content:
🩺  Unlocking Healthcare Excellence in the Middle East: Top Destinations, Leading Doctors, and the Road Ahead (part 1)As the Middle East continues its rapid transformation, one sector rising to the forefront is healthcare. Over the last decade, we’ve witnessed an incredible evolution- not just in infrastructure but in innovation, specialization, and global reputation. Countries across the region are now competing not only to serve their local populations but also to become global hubs for medical tourism.Here’s a look at where things stand, who’s leading the charge, and what opportunities lie ahead.🏥 Top Healthcare Destinations in the Middle East1. IranOften underrepresented in international rankings due to geopolitical factors, Iran is in fact one of the most advanced medical ecosystems in the region. With a high density of top-tier specialists, state-of-the-art surgical centers, and remarkably affordable pricing, Iran has become a go-to destination for patients from neighboring countries, Central Asia, and even Europe. From oncology and transplant surgery to fertility and reconstructive procedures, Iranian doctors are not only highly skilled but also often pioneers in their fields. Cities like Tehran, Shiraz, Mashhad, and Isfahan host globally respected hospitals and research institutions.2. United Arab Emirates (UAE)Dubai and Abu Dhabi have positioned themselves as world-class medical tourism destinations. With internationally accredited hospitals like Cleveland Clinic Abu Dhabi and Dubai Healthcare City, the UAE is attracting patients from across the GCC, Africa, and beyond.3. Saudi Arabia As part of Vision 2030, Saudi Arabia is heavily investing in transforming its healthcare sector. Riyadh and Jeddah now host a growing number of specialized hospitals, and the Kingdom is actively pursuing public-private partnerships (PPPs) to fast-track innovation and infrastructure.4. Remember when setting up in a UAE Free Zone felt like unlocking a treasure chest of tax benefits? Well, the map has changed, and it's time to chart a new course.The UAE's new corporate tax regime is here, and while Free Zone businesses can still enjoy a 0% tax rate, it's not automatic. To qualify as a Qualifying Free Zone Person (QFZP), you need to meet specific criteria:✅ Key Requirements:• Qualifying Income: Earn income from transactions with other Free Zone entities or from defined qualifying activities.• Substance Requirements: Maintain adequate physical presence and operations within the Free Zone.• De Minimis Rule: Ensure non-qualifying income doesn't exceed 5% of total revenue or AED 5 million, whichever is lower.• Audited Financials: Prepare and maintain audited financial statements in accordance with IFRS.⚠ Consequences of Non-Compliance: Failing to meet these conditions means losing QFZP status and being subject to the standard 9% corporate tax rate for at least five years.💡 Take Action Now: Review your business activities, ensure compliance with the new regulations, and consult with tax professionals to navigate this transition smoothly.hashtag#UAE hashtag#CorporateTax hashtag#FreeZone hashtag#BusinessStrategy hashtag#TaxCompliance hashtag#EconomicDiversification hashtag#TaxStrategy hashtag#QFZP hashtag#Brooksme

The Finance Skills That Helped Me Thrive in Dubai and Will Matter Even More in 2025!When I first moved to Dubai, I thought technical knowledge alone would be enough.But I quickly realized: finance here isn’t just about closing books. Financial Modeling & Forecasting In a city where industries evolve overnight, static budgets don’t cut it. You need models that breathe with the business.2. Data Analytics & Dashboarding (Power BI)It’s no longer about what happened. Stakeholders want to see why it happened, and that too visually, clearly, instantly.3. Automation & Process OptimizationTime is a premium. Automating even 10% of manual tasks can unlock hours for deeper, strategic work.4. Corporate Tax PlanningWith the UAE introducing corporate tax, businesses are seeking finance professionals who can navigate compliance and protect profitability.5. Strategic ThinkingFinance isn’t a back-office function anymore. You are at the table to influence where the business goes next.Dubai moves fast, and finance professionals here must be more than number crunchers. Pavilion layouts with more self-guided content could make discovery more intuitive—through interior models, videos, and visual storytelling.Personally, I thought Sustainable City 2.0 was a strong highlight, what I call an inspiring model for future developments. Renting vs Owning in Dubai – The Debate That Divides the SkylineLet’s break it once and for all:Renting a Property in DubaiPros: • No long-term commitment • Flexibility to move anytime • No maintenance headachesCons: • 100% money gone = 0 equity • Annual rent hikes • You’re paying someone else’s mortgageOwning a Property in DubaiPros: • Build equity over time • Stable payments (if mortgage) • Eligible for the Golden Visa (with AED 2M+ property) • Passive income through rental yieldsCons: • Initial down payment (usually 20–25%) • Long-term commitment • Market fluctuationsLet’s do the math:Paying AED 100,000/year in rent = AED 1 million burned in 10 years.Buy a property for AED 1.5M with 8% yield = AED 120,000/year income + value appreciation + Golden Visa.Now ask yourself:Do you want to rent your lifestyle or own your future?Because in Dubai, real estate isn’t just a transaction—it’s a transformation.Still confused? Let’s talk. I help people make life-changing moves every day.

The UAE Is Redefining Global Education InvestmentA massive move caught my attention: Mubadala and Dubai Holding joined forces with a global group to acquire Nord Anglia Education in a $14.5B deal one of the biggest education acquisitions ever.This isn’t just business. It’s a bold message: the hashtag#UAE isn’t just focusing on local education reform; it’s shaping how the world learns.Why does this matter? •	Mubadala’s $600M equity stake reflects a national strategy to invest in human capital and align with the UAE’s AI and innovation goals. •	Dubai Holding’s involvement shows how deeply education ties into the UAE’s positioning as a global hub for talent, families, and future industries. •	Nord Anglia isn’t just any operator 85,000+ students, 80+ schools in 33 countries, and partnerships with MIT, Juilliard, and UNICEF.The local context is just as powerful: •	827 international schools make the UAE #1 globally per capita. •	220+ of those are in Dubai alone. •	The UAE’s private K-12 market is projected to hit $7.1B by 2027. •	Education remains one of the largest priorities in the federal budget.This deal isn’t just about returns it’s about long term influence, future proofing our youth, and making the UAE a reference point for educational excellence worldwide.Smart nations build roads. Visionary ones build minds. 🇦🇪

Username: Jonathan Burns جونثان برنزJonathan Burns جونثان برنز
Post Content:
🌍 KSA’s New UBO Disclosure Rules – Initial Observations 🌍 The new Ultimate Beneficial Ownership (UBO) disclosure rules of the Ministry of Commerce have now been in effect in Saudi Arabia for two weeks. Based on early experience, here are some key features—and notable sticking points—of the framework:WHO IS SUBJECT TO THE OBLIGATION?👉 Only legal entities incorporated in KSA are required to comply. In practice, the entity will have a dedicated page within its government e-portal account to satisfy the UBO disclosure.👉 Important to note: Technically, the disclosure obligation does not extend to shareholders, foreign parent companies, or shell entities in the corporate chain. The responsibility lies with the KSA subsidiary.WHAT TRIGGERS A DISCLOSURE OBLIGATION?UBO disclosure obligations can be triggered objectively and subjectively: 1️⃣  Objectively, the obligation is triggered by having, directly or indirectly:  ▪️ ≥25% shareholding or voting rights in a KSA legal entity, and/or  ▪️ the power to appoint or dismiss a KSA legal entity’s manager, the majority of its board members, or its chairperson. 2️⃣ Subjectively, the obligation is triggered by having, directly or indirectly, the ability to “influence” a KSA legal entity’s operations or decisions.⚠️ Sticking point: “Influence” is not defined in the rules, leaving room for interpretation and potential compliance risk.WHO TRIGGERS THE OBLIGATION?👉 Natural persons meeting the above thresholds must be identified. HOWEVER, for corporate entities in the ownership chain meeting any of the above triggers, Article 4.1.e. requires the disclosure of a “legal representative”—even up through multiple levels.⚠️ Sticking point: “Legal representative” is also undefined and may vary depending on the jurisdiction of incorporation.WHEN MUST DISCLOSURE OCCUR?▪️ At incorporation for new entities▪️ By the next commercial register anniversary for existing entities⚠️ Sticking point: There is no grace period, meaning entities nearing their anniversary may face an urgent compliance timeline.📝 Looking ahead...Article 7.3 of the Rules provides that the Ministry will issue a detailed Guide, which should clarify these ambiguities. As of today, that guidance has not yet been released.This summary reflects general observations to date. There are exclusions, exceptions, and additional complexities not addressed here.hashtag#SaudiArabia hashtag#CorporateLaw hashtag#UBO hashtag#Compliance hashtag#RegulatoryUpdates hashtag#KSA hashtag#BusinessLaw hashtag#CorporateGovernance hashtag#MiddleEastLaw hashtag#LegalUpdates hashtag#MinistryOfCommerce hashtag#KSACompliance hashtag#BeneficialOwnership

UAE Doubles Down on Global Education: $14.5B Deal with Nord Anglia Education Signals New Era in Talent Investment In April 2025, Mubadala Investment Company and Dubai Holding joined a global consortium to acquire Nord Anglia Education a premium international schools operator in a $14.5 billion megadeal, one of the largest education-focused acquisitions in history.The UAE is no longer just educating its youth it’s investing in how the world learns.Who’s Involved in the $14.5B Consortium?1. EQT Group – Europe’s largest PE firm 2. Neuberger Berman 3. Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPP Investments)4. Corporación Financiera Alba5. Mubadala Investment Company – $600M stake (confirmed)6. Dubai Holding – strategic investor (amount undisclosed)Why Mubadala Made This InvestmentMubadala’s $600M equity stake is not just capital deployment it’s part of a national capability strategy:1. Human Capital First: Mubadala aligns with the UAE’s vision that education is the cornerstone of national prosperity.2. Future Workforce Fit: Nord Anglia’s AI, STEAM, and leadership programs are aligned with UAE’s AI Strategy 2031 and Fourth Industrial Revolution goals.3. Global Returns, Local Impact: Investing in a global operator helps bring best practices to the UAE and generate returns that diversify away from oil.Why Dubai Holding Joined the DealDubai Holding’s participation is deeply strategic it goes beyond finance and reflects a long-term vision:1. City Branding: Dubai aims to be the #1 global city for living, working, and raising families. World-class education is central to that.2. Direct Ecosystem Benefit: Nord Anglia already operates two leading schools in Dubai. This investment strengthens Dubai’s appeal to global talent and companies.3. Soft Power Diplomacy: Enhancing Dubai’s presence in global education circles elevates its cultural and institutional reputation.Why Nord Anglia?1. 85,000+ students | 80+ campuses | 33 countries2. Over 50% of students enter Top 100 QS-ranked universities3. Strategic partnerships with MIT, Juilliard, UNICEF4. AI, coding, entrepreneurship integrated from early stages5. Flagships in: Dubai, Abu Dhabi, New York, Dublin, Hong Kong, GenevaThe UAE’s Local Education Ecosystem:1. 827 international schools the largest per capita globally2. AED 26B ($7.1B): Projected UAE private K-12 market by 2027 3. 220+ international schools in Dubai alone4. 60,000+ new student seats added in 2 years5. 35% of UAE population is under 256. 89% expat population requires premium education options7. 40% of UAE’s federal budget (2025) allocated to social development education is the top priorityThis investment future-proofs the economy, drives educational reform, and expands the nation’s global influence in shaping knowledge ecosystems.This is how visionary nations invest not just in infrastructure but in intellect.

A Dubai-based developer called me in a panic.They were finalizing a luxury residential sale — but their VAT refund worth AED 58,000 had been stuck for months.Here’s what happened: → They missed the filing deadline for Q3 → Filed Q4 late, without reconciling Q3 → FTA flagged both and paused refund processing → Meanwhile, cash flow was blocked — delaying their payment to a contractorTotal cost: → AED 4,000 in late fines → AED 58,000 refund delayed → AED 400K project payment stuck for 3 weeks📌 Late filings aren’t just a fine — they block cash, refunds, and deals.What we did: → Filed voluntary disclosures for both quarters → Reconciled past returns and cleared documentation gaps → Recovered the refund in 29 days💬 DM me “VAT Fix” if you’ve missed deadlines in the past 6 months — let’s prevent penalties before they pile up.hashtag#UAERealEstate hashtag#VATCompliance hashtag#FTA hashtag#CashFlow

🩺  Unlocking Healthcare Excellence in the Middle East: Top Destinations, Leading Doctors, and the Road Ahead (part 1)As the Middle East continues its rapid transformation, one sector rising to the forefront is healthcare. Over the last decade, we’ve witnessed an incredible evolution- not just in infrastructure but in innovation, specialization, and global reputation. Countries across the region are now competing not only to serve their local populations but also to become global hubs for medical tourism.Here’s a look at where things stand, who’s leading the charge, and what opportunities lie ahead.🏥 Top Healthcare Destinations in the Middle East1. IranOften underrepresented in international rankings due to geopolitical factors, Iran is in fact one of the most advanced medical ecosystems in the region. With a high density of top-tier specialists, state-of-the-art surgical centers, and remarkably affordable pricing, Iran has become a go-to destination for patients from neighboring countries, Central Asia, and even Europe. From oncology and transplant surgery to fertility and reconstructive procedures, Iranian doctors are not only highly skilled but also often pioneers in their fields. Cities like Tehran, Shiraz, Mashhad, and Isfahan host globally respected hospitals and research institutions.2. United Arab Emirates (UAE)Dubai and Abu Dhabi have positioned themselves as world-class medical tourism destinations. With internationally accredited hospitals like Cleveland Clinic Abu Dhabi and Dubai Healthcare City, the UAE is attracting patients from across the GCC, Africa, and beyond.3. Saudi Arabia As part of Vision 2030, Saudi Arabia is heavily investing in transforming its healthcare sector. Riyadh and Jeddah now host a growing number of specialized hospitals, and the Kingdom is actively pursuing public-private partnerships (PPPs) to fast-track innovation and infrastructure.4. QatarHome to Sidra Medicine and Hamad Medical Corporation, Qatar is building a reputation for excellence in pediatric and women's health, with a strong focus on research and academic partnerships.5. Jordan and LebanonKnown for decades as go-to destinations for affordable, high-quality care, particularly in cardiology, oncology, and cosmetic procedures. These countries remain key players, especially for patients from North Africa and the Levant.hashtag#Healthcare hashtag#MiddleEast hashtag#HealthTech hashtag#Investment hashtag#Innovation hashtag#DigitalHealth hashtag#Iran hashtag#UAE hashtag#Saudiarabia hashtag#Qatar hashtag#Jordan hashtag#Lebanon hashtag#doctor

Remember when setting up in a UAE Free Zone felt like unlocking a treasure chest of tax benefits? Well, the map has changed, and it's time to chart a new course.The UAE's new corporate tax regime is here, and while Free Zone businesses can still enjoy a 0% tax rate, it's not automatic. To qualify as a Qualifying Free Zone Person (QFZP), you need to meet specific criteria:✅ Key Requirements:• Qualifying Income: Earn income from transactions with other Free Zone entities or from defined qualifying activities.• Substance Requirements: Maintain adequate physical presence and operations within the Free Zone.• De Minimis Rule: Ensure non-qualifying income doesn't exceed 5% of total revenue or AED 5 million, whichever is lower.• Audited Financials: Prepare and maintain audited financial statements in accordance with IFRS.⚠ Consequences of Non-Compliance: Failing to meet these conditions means losing QFZP status and being subject to the standard 9% corporate tax rate for at least five years.💡 Take Action Now: Review your business activities, ensure compliance with the new regulations, and consult with tax professionals to navigate this transition smoothly.hashtag#UAE hashtag#CorporateTax hashtag#FreeZone hashtag#BusinessStrategy hashtag#TaxCompliance hashtag#EconomicDiversification hashtag#TaxStrategy hashtag#QFZP hashtag#Brooksme

Strategic ThinkingFinance isn’t a back-office function anymore. IPS Dubai was full of energy, innovation, and exciting real estate opportunities.As an architect who always steps into the client’s shoes, I couldn’t help but imagine how the visitor experience could have been more interactive, here is what came to mind :1. A clearer focus on what makes each project stand out would be inspiring.2. Interiors deserve as much spotlight as the beautiful façades.3. VR tech could elevate how people explore spaces.4. Pavilion layouts with more self-guided content could make discovery more intuitive—through interior models, videos, and visual storytelling.Personally, I thought Sustainable City 2.0 was a strong highlight, what I call an inspiring model for future developments. Renting vs Owning in Dubai – The Debate That Divides the SkylineLet’s break it once and for all:Renting a Property in DubaiPros: • No long-term commitment • Flexibility to move anytime • No maintenance headachesCons: • 100% money gone = 0 equity • Annual rent hikes • You’re paying someone else’s mortgageOwning a Property in DubaiPros: • Build equity over time • Stable payments (if mortgage) • Eligible for the Golden Visa (with AED 2M+ property) • Passive income through rental yieldsCons: • Initial down payment (usually 20–25%) • Long-term commitment • Market fluctuationsLet’s do the math:Paying AED 100,000/year in rent = AED 1 million burned in 10 years.Buy a property for AED 1.5M with 8% yield = AED 120,000/year income + value appreciation + Golden Visa.Now ask yourself:Do you want to rent your lifestyle or own your future?Because in Dubai, real estate isn’t just a transaction—it’s a transformation.Still confused? Let’s talk. I help people make life-changing moves every day.

It’s a bold message: the hashtag#UAE isn’t just focusing on local education reform; it’s shaping how the world learns.Why does this matter? •	Mubadala’s $600M equity stake reflects a national strategy to invest in human capital and align with the UAE’s AI and innovation goals. •	Dubai Holding’s involvement shows how deeply education ties into the UAE’s positioning as a global hub for talent, families, and future industries. •	Nord Anglia isn’t just any operator 85,000+ students, 80+ schools in 33 countries, and partnerships with MIT, Juilliard, and UNICEF.The local context is just as powerful: •	827 international schools make the UAE #1 globally per capita. •	220+ of those are in Dubai alone. •	The UAE’s private K-12 market is projected to hit $7.1B by 2027. •	Education remains one of the largest priorities in the federal budget.This deal isn’t just about returns it’s about long term influence, future proofing our youth, and making the UAE a reference point for educational excellence worldwide.Smart nations build roads. Visionary ones build minds. 🇦🇪

Username: Jonathan Burns جونثان برنزJonathan Burns جونثان برنز
Post Content:
🌍 KSA’s New UBO Disclosure Rules – Initial Observations 🌍 The new Ultimate Beneficial Ownership (UBO) disclosure rules of the Ministry of Commerce have now been in effect in Saudi Arabia for two weeks. Based on early experience, here are some key features—and notable sticking points—of the framework:WHO IS SUBJECT TO THE OBLIGATION?👉 Only legal entities incorporated in KSA are required to comply. In practice, the entity will have a dedicated page within its government e-portal account to satisfy the UBO disclosure.👉 Important to note: Technically, the disclosure obligation does not extend to shareholders, foreign parent companies, or shell entities in the corporate chain. The responsibility lies with the KSA subsidiary.WHAT TRIGGERS A DISCLOSURE OBLIGATION?UBO disclosure obligations can be triggered objectively and subjectively: 1️⃣  Objectively, the obligation is triggered by having, directly or indirectly:  ▪️ ≥25% shareholding or voting rights in a KSA legal entity, and/or  ▪️ the power to appoint or dismiss a KSA legal entity’s manager, the majority of its board members, or its chairperson. 2️⃣ Subjectively, the obligation is triggered by having, directly or indirectly, the ability to “influence” a KSA legal entity’s operations or decisions.⚠️ Sticking point: “Influence” is not defined in the rules, leaving room for interpretation and potential compliance risk.WHO TRIGGERS THE OBLIGATION?👉 Natural persons meeting the above thresholds must be identified. HOWEVER, for corporate entities in the ownership chain meeting any of the above triggers, Article 4.1.e. requires the disclosure of a “legal representative”—even up through multiple levels.⚠️ Sticking point: “Legal representative” is also undefined and may vary depending on the jurisdiction of incorporation.WHEN MUST DISCLOSURE OCCUR?▪️ At incorporation for new entities▪️ By the next commercial register anniversary for existing entities⚠️ Sticking point: There is no grace period, meaning entities nearing their anniversary may face an urgent compliance timeline.📝 Looking ahead...Article 7.3 of the Rules provides that the Ministry will issue a detailed Guide, which should clarify these ambiguities. As of today, that guidance has not yet been released.This summary reflects general observations to date. There are exclusions, exceptions, and additional complexities not addressed here.hashtag#SaudiArabia hashtag#CorporateLaw hashtag#UBO hashtag#Compliance hashtag#RegulatoryUpdates hashtag#KSA hashtag#BusinessLaw hashtag#CorporateGovernance hashtag#MiddleEastLaw hashtag#LegalUpdates hashtag#MinistryOfCommerce hashtag#KSACompliance hashtag#BeneficialOwnership

UAE Doubles Down on Global Education: $14.5B Deal with Nord Anglia Education Signals New Era in Talent Investment In April 2025, Mubadala Investment Company and Dubai Holding joined a global consortium to acquire Nord Anglia Education a premium international schools operator in a $14.5 billion megadeal, one of the largest education-focused acquisitions in history.The UAE is no longer just educating its youth it’s investing in how the world learns.Who’s Involved in the $14.5B Consortium?1. EQT Group – Europe’s largest PE firm 2. Neuberger Berman 3. Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPP Investments)4. Corporación Financiera Alba5. Mubadala Investment Company – $600M stake (confirmed)6. Dubai Holding – strategic investor (amount undisclosed)Why Mubadala Made This InvestmentMubadala’s $600M equity stake is not just capital deployment it’s part of a national capability strategy:1. Human Capital First: Mubadala aligns with the UAE’s vision that education is the cornerstone of national prosperity.2. Future Workforce Fit: Nord Anglia’s AI, STEAM, and leadership programs are aligned with UAE’s AI Strategy 2031 and Fourth Industrial Revolution goals.3. Global Returns, Local Impact: Investing in a global operator helps bring best practices to the UAE and generate returns that diversify away from oil.Why Dubai Holding Joined the DealDubai Holding’s participation is deeply strategic it goes beyond finance and reflects a long-term vision:1. City Branding: Dubai aims to be the #1 global city for living, working, and raising families. World-class education is central to that.2. Direct Ecosystem Benefit: Nord Anglia already operates two leading schools in Dubai. This investment strengthens Dubai’s appeal to global talent and companies.3. Soft Power Diplomacy: Enhancing Dubai’s presence in global education circles elevates its cultural and institutional reputation.Why Nord Anglia?1. 85,000+ students | 80+ campuses | 33 countries2. Over 50% of students enter Top 100 QS-ranked universities3. Strategic partnerships with MIT, Juilliard, UNICEF4. AI, coding, entrepreneurship integrated from early stages5. Flagships in: Dubai, Abu Dhabi, New York, Dublin, Hong Kong, GenevaThe UAE’s Local Education Ecosystem:1. 827 international schools the largest per capita globally2. AED 26B ($7.1B): Projected UAE private K-12 market by 2027 3. 220+ international schools in Dubai alone4. 60,000+ new student seats added in 2 years5. 35% of UAE population is under 256. 89% expat population requires premium education options7. 40% of UAE’s federal budget (2025) allocated to social development education is the top priorityThis investment future-proofs the economy, drives educational reform, and expands the nation’s global influence in shaping knowledge ecosystems.This is how visionary nations invest not just in infrastructure but in intellect.

A Dubai-based developer called me in a panic.They were finalizing a luxury residential sale — but their VAT refund worth AED 58,000 had been stuck for months.Here’s what happened: → They missed the filing deadline for Q3 → Filed Q4 late, without reconciling Q3 → FTA flagged both and paused refund processing → Meanwhile, cash flow was blocked — delaying their payment to a contractorTotal cost: → AED 4,000 in late fines → AED 58,000 refund delayed → AED 400K project payment stuck for 3 weeks📌 Late filings aren’t just a fine — they block cash, refunds, and deals.What we did: → Filed voluntary disclosures for both quarters → Reconciled past returns and cleared documentation gaps → Recovered the refund in 29 days💬 DM me “VAT Fix” if you’ve missed deadlines in the past 6 months — let’s prevent penalties before they pile up.hashtag#UAERealEstate hashtag#VATCompliance hashtag#FTA hashtag#CashFlow

🩺  Unlocking Healthcare Excellence in the Middle East: Top Destinations, Leading Doctors, and the Road Ahead (part 1)As the Middle East continues its rapid transformation, one sector rising to the forefront is healthcare. Over the last decade, we’ve witnessed an incredible evolution- not just in infrastructure but in innovation, specialization, and global reputation. Countries across the region are now competing not only to serve their local populations but also to become global hubs for medical tourism.Here’s a look at where things stand, who’s leading the charge, and what opportunities lie ahead.🏥 Top Healthcare Destinations in the Middle East1. IranOften underrepresented in international rankings due to geopolitical factors, Iran is in fact one of the most advanced medical ecosystems in the region. With a high density of top-tier specialists, state-of-the-art surgical centers, and remarkably affordable pricing, Iran has become a go-to destination for patients from neighboring countries, Central Asia, and even Europe. From oncology and transplant surgery to fertility and reconstructive procedures, Iranian doctors are not only highly skilled but also often pioneers in their fields. Cities like Tehran, Shiraz, Mashhad, and Isfahan host globally respected hospitals and research institutions.2. United Arab Emirates (UAE)Dubai and Abu Dhabi have positioned themselves as world-class medical tourism destinations. With internationally accredited hospitals like Cleveland Clinic Abu Dhabi and Dubai Healthcare City, the UAE is attracting patients from across the GCC, Africa, and beyond.3. Saudi Arabia As part of Vision 2030, Saudi Arabia is heavily investing in transforming its healthcare sector. Riyadh and Jeddah now host a growing number of specialized hospitals, and the Kingdom is actively pursuing public-private partnerships (PPPs) to fast-track innovation and infrastructure.4. QatarHome to Sidra Medicine and Hamad Medical Corporation, Qatar is building a reputation for excellence in pediatric and women's health, with a strong focus on research and academic partnerships.5. Jordan and LebanonKnown for decades as go-to destinations for affordable, high-quality care, particularly in cardiology, oncology, and cosmetic procedures. These countries remain key players, especially for patients from North Africa and the Levant.hashtag#Healthcare hashtag#MiddleEast hashtag#HealthTech hashtag#Investment hashtag#Innovation hashtag#DigitalHealth hashtag#Iran hashtag#UAE hashtag#Saudiarabia hashtag#Qatar hashtag#Jordan hashtag#Lebanon hashtag#doctor

Remember when setting up in a UAE Free Zone felt like unlocking a treasure chest of tax benefits? Well, the map has changed, and it's time to chart a new course.The UAE's new corporate tax regime is here, and while Free Zone businesses can still enjoy a 0% tax rate, it's not automatic. To qualify as a Qualifying Free Zone Person (QFZP), you need to meet specific criteria:✅ Key Requirements:• Qualifying Income: Earn income from transactions with other Free Zone entities or from defined qualifying activities.• Substance Requirements: Maintain adequate physical presence and operations within the Free Zone.• De Minimis Rule: Ensure non-qualifying income doesn't exceed 5% of total revenue or AED 5 million, whichever is lower.• Audited Financials: Prepare and maintain audited financial statements in accordance with IFRS.⚠ Consequences of Non-Compliance: Failing to meet these conditions means losing QFZP status and being subject to the standard 9% corporate tax rate for at least five years.💡 Take Action Now: Review your business activities, ensure compliance with the new regulations, and consult with tax professionals to navigate this transition smoothly.hashtag#UAE hashtag#CorporateTax hashtag#FreeZone hashtag#BusinessStrategy hashtag#TaxCompliance hashtag#EconomicDiversification hashtag#TaxStrategy hashtag#QFZP hashtag#Brooksme

From 2009 to 2020, Espace brokers competed for some incredible prizes. Four Rolex watches in a single four month competition, boat parties, and multiple incentive trips to Las Vegas were just a few of the rewards up for grabs.Since COVID, as the Dubai property market has built strong momentum, industry incentives have ramped up once again. But while prizes and perks do play a role in motivation, they’re the easy part of the recipe and should be seen for what they are… the cherry on top.The real engine behind broker success isn’t gimmicks. It’s the strength of the platform they operate in. At Espace, everything is built around one core focus: creating a marketplace that gives brokers the highest possible chance to perform at their best and deliver exceptional revenue.While anyone can compete in the incentives game, it’s not a level playing field when it comes to the strength of the marketplace itself, and that’s where the real difference is made.hashtag#espacerealestate hashtag#dubai hashtag#mydubai hashtag#dubaibrokers hashtag#realestatedubai hashtag#dubairealestate hashtag#property hashtag#propertymarket

O Brasil tem avançado significativamente na modernização de sua infraestrutura aeroportuária. Nos últimos anos, a ampliação do modelo de concessões e os investimentos em eficiência operacional vêm transformando o setor, ampliando a conectividade regional e elevando a qualidade dos serviços prestados.Gerir aeroportos com eficiência envolve mais do que obras: requer planejamento integrado, controle rigoroso de custos, governança sólida e compromisso com metas de desempenho e sustentabilidade.É nesse contexto que a combinação entre expertise global e conhecimento local se torna essencial. Projetos de referência internacional, como o Zayed International Airport, mostram como é possível entregar soluções complexas com excelência e oferecem aprendizados que podem ser adaptados às realidades locais, respeitando os desafios específicos de cada mercado.Regionalmente, a Turner & Townsend aplica metodologias de classe mundial com olhar atento às necessidades do setor aeroportuário nacional, apoiando na gestão de grandes projetos, desde o planejamento até a entrega.Acreditamos que a evolução da infraestrutura no país depende de uma atuação técnica, estratégica e integrada e seguimos comprometidos em contribuir para um setor mais eficiente, resiliente e preparado para o futuro.hashtag#Infraestrutura hashtag#Aviação hashtag#WeTransformTogether

Buying vs. Renting in Dubai — What’s More Profitable?The debate between buying and renting in Dubai is always on. Some say renting is flexible, others say buying is a smarter, long-term move. So, which is more profitable?Here’s the breakdown:General Thought: Why Buying Beats Renting?Renting might offer short-term convenience, but buying builds real value. You’re investing in an asset, not just paying for a place to stay.The Real Numbers: Rent vs BuyLet’s compare:Monthly Rent: AED 8,333Monthly Mortgage: AED 4,584➡ Buying is 45% cheaper than renting.Over time:Total Rent (5 years): AED 499,980Total Buy (10 years): AED 550,080➡ Renting saves a bit short-term, but you own nothing.➡ Buying builds equity, ownership, and long-term value.Conclusion: Ownership Pays OffIn markets like Dubai where prices are rising, buying means capital growth, rental income potential, and full ownership — while renting leaves you with nothing at the end.Reach out to see how buying can work for you — with real numbers, tailored to your situation!التملك أو الإيجار في دبي؟ الأرقام ما تكذب – التملك أوفر وأذكى. في سوق عقاري سريع النمو مثل دبي، التملّك لا يُعدّ مجرد خيار، بل هو خطوة استراتيجية لبناء أصول حقيقية وتحقيق عوائد مستمرة. أما الإيجار؟ فهو إنفاق شهري دون أي ملكية مستقبلية.لماذا يعتبر التملّك الخيار الأفضل ماليًا؟ لأن القسط الشهري في كثير من الحالات يكون أقل من قيمة الإيجار، ومع مرور الوقت، تصبح المِلكية كاملة لك. بالإضافة إلى إمكانية تحقيق أرباح من ارتفاع قيمة العقار أو تأجيره لاحقًا. في المقابل، الإيجار يُدفع باستمرار دون أي مردود مالي.الأرقام الحقيقية: دعونا نقارن بين الخيارين في الأرقام:الإيجار الشهري: 8,333 درهمقسط التملك الشهري: 4,584 درهم ✅ التملك يوفّر لك 45% من التكاليف الشهرية مقارنة بالإيجار.إجمالي التكاليف:الإيجار ( 5 سنوات): 499,980 درهمالتملك ( 10 سنوات): 550,080 درهم ✅ رغم أن الإيجار قد يوفّر بعض رأس المال على المدى القصير، إلا أن التملك يمنحك أصلًا حقيقيًا يبني ثروتك مع الوقت. بينما قد يكون الإيجار خيارًا مرنًا على المدى القصير، إلا أن التملك في دبي يوفر استقرارًا ماليًا طويل الأجل وقيمة استثمارية عالية.

IPS Dubai was full of energy, innovation, and exciting real estate opportunities.As an architect who always steps into the client’s shoes, I couldn’t help but imagine how the visitor experience could have been more interactive, here is what came to mind :1. A clearer focus on what makes each project stand out would be inspiring.2. Interiors deserve as much spotlight as the beautiful façades.3. VR tech could elevate how people explore spaces.4. Pavilion layouts with more self-guided content could make discovery more intuitive—through interior models, videos, and visual storytelling.Personally, I thought Sustainable City 2.0 was a strong highlight, what I call an inspiring model for future developments. Renting vs Owning in Dubai – The Debate That Divides the SkylineLet’s break it once and for all:Renting a Property in DubaiPros: • No long-term commitment • Flexibility to move anytime • No maintenance headachesCons: • 100% money gone = 0 equity • Annual rent hikes • You’re paying someone else’s mortgageOwning a Property in DubaiPros: • Build equity over time • Stable payments (if mortgage) • Eligible for the Golden Visa (with AED 2M+ property) • Passive income through rental yieldsCons: • Initial down payment (usually 20–25%) • Long-term commitment • Market fluctuationsLet’s do the math:Paying AED 100,000/year in rent = AED 1 million burned in 10 years.Buy a property for AED 1.5M with 8% yield = AED 120,000/year income + value appreciation + Golden Visa.Now ask yourself:Do you want to rent your lifestyle or own your future?Because in Dubai, real estate isn’t just a transaction—it’s a transformation.Still confused? Let’s talk. I help people make life-changing moves every day.

The UAE Is Redefining Global Education InvestmentA massive move caught my attention: Mubadala and Dubai Holding joined forces with a global group to acquire Nord Anglia Education in a $14.5B deal one of the biggest education acquisitions ever.This isn’t just business. It’s a bold message: the hashtag#UAE isn’t just focusing on local education reform; it’s shaping how the world learns.Why does this matter? •	Mubadala’s $600M equity stake reflects a national strategy to invest in human capital and align with the UAE’s AI and innovation goals. •	Dubai Holding’s involvement shows how deeply education ties into the UAE’s positioning as a global hub for talent, families, and future industries. •	Nord Anglia isn’t just any operator 85,000+ students, 80+ schools in 33 countries, and partnerships with MIT, Juilliard, and UNICEF.The local context is just as powerful: •	827 international schools make the UAE #1 globally per capita. •	220+ of those are in Dubai alone. •	The UAE’s private K-12 market is projected to hit $7.1B by 2027. •	Education remains one of the largest priorities in the federal budget.This deal isn’t just about returns it’s about long term influence, future proofing our youth, and making the UAE a reference point for educational excellence worldwide.Smart nations build roads. Visionary ones build minds. 🇦🇪

Username: Jonathan Burns جونثان برنزJonathan Burns جونثان برنز
Post Content:
🌍 KSA’s New UBO Disclosure Rules – Initial Observations 🌍 The new Ultimate Beneficial Ownership (UBO) disclosure rules of the Ministry of Commerce have now been in effect in Saudi Arabia for two weeks. Based on early experience, here are some key features—and notable sticking points—of the framework:WHO IS SUBJECT TO THE OBLIGATION?👉 Only legal entities incorporated in KSA are required to comply. In practice, the entity will have a dedicated page within its government e-portal account to satisfy the UBO disclosure.👉 Important to note: Technically, the disclosure obligation does not extend to shareholders, foreign parent companies, or shell entities in the corporate chain. The responsibility lies with the KSA subsidiary.WHAT TRIGGERS A DISCLOSURE OBLIGATION?UBO disclosure obligations can be triggered objectively and subjectively: 1️⃣  Objectively, the obligation is triggered by having, directly or indirectly:  ▪️ ≥25% shareholding or voting rights in a KSA legal entity, and/or  ▪️ the power to appoint or dismiss a KSA legal entity’s manager, the majority of its board members, or its chairperson. 2️⃣ Subjectively, the obligation is triggered by having, directly or indirectly, the ability to “influence” a KSA legal entity’s operations or decisions.⚠️ Sticking point: “Influence” is not defined in the rules, leaving room for interpretation and potential compliance risk.WHO TRIGGERS THE OBLIGATION?👉 Natural persons meeting the above thresholds must be identified. HOWEVER, for corporate entities in the ownership chain meeting any of the above triggers, Article 4.1.e. requires the disclosure of a “legal representative”—even up through multiple levels.⚠️ Sticking point: “Legal representative” is also undefined and may vary depending on the jurisdiction of incorporation.WHEN MUST DISCLOSURE OCCUR?▪️ At incorporation for new entities▪️ By the next commercial register anniversary for existing entities⚠️ Sticking point: There is no grace period, meaning entities nearing their anniversary may face an urgent compliance timeline.📝 Looking ahead...Article 7.3 of the Rules provides that the Ministry will issue a detailed Guide, which should clarify these ambiguities. As of today, that guidance has not yet been released.This summary reflects general observations to date. There are exclusions, exceptions, and additional complexities not addressed here.hashtag#SaudiArabia hashtag#CorporateLaw hashtag#UBO hashtag#Compliance hashtag#RegulatoryUpdates hashtag#KSA hashtag#BusinessLaw hashtag#CorporateGovernance hashtag#MiddleEastLaw hashtag#LegalUpdates hashtag#MinistryOfCommerce hashtag#KSACompliance hashtag#BeneficialOwnership

UAE Doubles Down on Global Education: $14.5B Deal with Nord Anglia Education Signals New Era in Talent Investment In April 2025, Mubadala Investment Company and Dubai Holding joined a global consortium to acquire Nord Anglia Education a premium international schools operator in a $14.5 billion megadeal, one of the largest education-focused acquisitions in history.The UAE is no longer just educating its youth it’s investing in how the world learns.Who’s Involved in the $14.5B Consortium?1. EQT Group – Europe’s largest PE firm 2. Neuberger Berman 3. Canada Pension Plan Investment Board (CPP Investments)4. Corporación Financiera Alba5. Mubadala Investment Company – $600M stake (confirmed)6. Dubai Holding – strategic investor (amount undisclosed)Why Mubadala Made This InvestmentMubadala’s $600M equity stake is not just capital deployment it’s part of a national capability strategy:1. Human Capital First: Mubadala aligns with the UAE’s vision that education is the cornerstone of national prosperity.2. Future Workforce Fit: Nord Anglia’s AI, STEAM, and leadership programs are aligned with UAE’s AI Strategy 2031 and Fourth Industrial Revolution goals.3. Global Returns, Local Impact: Investing in a global operator helps bring best practices to the UAE and generate returns that diversify away from oil.Why Dubai Holding Joined the DealDubai Holding’s participation is deeply strategic it goes beyond finance and reflects a long-term vision:1. City Branding: Dubai aims to be the #1 global city for living, working, and raising families. World-class education is central to that.2. Direct Ecosystem Benefit: Nord Anglia already operates two leading schools in Dubai. This investment strengthens Dubai’s appeal to global talent and companies.3. Soft Power Diplomacy: Enhancing Dubai’s presence in global education circles elevates its cultural and institutional reputation.Why Nord Anglia?1. 85,000+ students | 80+ campuses | 33 countries2. Over 50% of students enter Top 100 QS-ranked universities3. Strategic partnerships with MIT, Juilliard, UNICEF4. AI, coding, entrepreneurship integrated from early stages5. Flagships in: Dubai, Abu Dhabi, New York, Dublin, Hong Kong, GenevaThe UAE’s Local Education Ecosystem:1. 827 international schools the largest per capita globally2. AED 26B ($7.1B): Projected UAE private K-12 market by 2027 3. 220+ international schools in Dubai alone4. 60,000+ new student seats added in 2 years5. 35% of UAE population is under 256. 89% expat population requires premium education options7. 40% of UAE’s federal budget (2025) allocated to social development education is the top priorityThis investment future-proofs the economy, drives educational reform, and expands the nation’s global influence in shaping knowledge ecosystems.This is how visionary nations invest not just in infrastructure but in intellect.

A Dubai-based developer called me in a panic.They were finalizing a luxury residential sale — but their VAT refund worth AED 58,000 had been stuck for months.Here’s what happened: → They missed the filing deadline for Q3 → Filed Q4 late, without reconciling Q3 → FTA flagged both and paused refund processing → Meanwhile, cash flow was blocked — delaying their payment to a contractorTotal cost: → AED 4,000 in late fines → AED 58,000 refund delayed → AED 400K project payment stuck for 3 weeks📌 Late filings aren’t just a fine — they block cash, refunds, and deals.What we did: → Filed voluntary disclosures for both quarters → Reconciled past returns and cleared documentation gaps → Recovered the refund in 29 days💬 DM me “VAT Fix” if you’ve missed deadlines in the past 6 months — let’s prevent penalties before they pile up.hashtag#UAERealEstate hashtag#VATCompliance hashtag#FTA hashtag#CashFlow

🩺  Unlocking Healthcare Excellence in the Middle East: Top Destinations, Leading Doctors, and the Road Ahead (part 1)As the Middle East continues its rapid transformation, one sector rising to the forefront is healthcare. Over the last decade, we’ve witnessed an incredible evolution- not just in infrastructure but in innovation, specialization, and global reputation. Countries across the region are now competing not only to serve their local populations but also to become global hubs for medical tourism.Here’s a look at where things stand, who’s leading the charge, and what opportunities lie ahead.🏥 Top Healthcare Destinations in the Middle East1. IranOften underrepresented in international rankings due to geopolitical factors, Iran is in fact one of the most advanced medical ecosystems in the region. With a high density of top-tier specialists, state-of-the-art surgical centers, and remarkably affordable pricing, Iran has become a go-to destination for patients from neighboring countries, Central Asia, and even Europe. From oncology and transplant surgery to fertility and reconstructive procedures, Iranian doctors are not only highly skilled but also often pioneers in their fields. Cities like Tehran, Shiraz, Mashhad, and Isfahan host globally respected hospitals and research institutions.2. United Arab Emirates (UAE)Dubai and Abu Dhabi have positioned themselves as world-class medical tourism destinations. With internationally accredited hospitals like Cleveland Clinic Abu Dhabi and Dubai Healthcare City, the UAE is attracting patients from across the GCC, Africa, and beyond.3. Saudi Arabia As part of Vision 2030, Saudi Arabia is heavily investing in transforming its healthcare sector. Riyadh and Jeddah now host a growing number of specialized hospitals, and the Kingdom is actively pursuing public-private partnerships (PPPs) to fast-track innovation and infrastructure.4. QatarHome to Sidra Medicine and Hamad Medical Corporation, Qatar is building a reputation for excellence in pediatric and women's health, with a strong focus on research and academic partnerships.5. Jordan and LebanonKnown for decades as go-to destinations for affordable, high-quality care, particularly in cardiology, oncology, and cosmetic procedures. These countries remain key players, especially for patients from North Africa and the Levant.hashtag#Healthcare hashtag#MiddleEast hashtag#HealthTech hashtag#Investment hashtag#Innovation hashtag#DigitalHealth hashtag#Iran hashtag#UAE hashtag#Saudiarabia hashtag#Qatar hashtag#Jordan hashtag#Lebanon hashtag#doctor

Remember when setting up in a UAE Free Zone felt like unlocking a treasure chest of tax benefits? Well, the map has changed, and it's time to chart a new course.The UAE's new corporate tax regime is here, and while Free Zone businesses can still enjoy a 0% tax rate, it's not automatic. To qualify as a Qualifying Free Zone Person (QFZP), you need to meet specific criteria:✅ Key Requirements:• Qualifying Income: Earn income from transactions with other Free Zone entities or from defined qualifying activities.• Substance Requirements: Maintain adequate physical presence and operations within the Free Zone.• De Minimis Rule: Ensure non-qualifying income doesn't exceed 5% of total revenue or AED 5 million, whichever is lower.• Audited Financials: Prepare and maintain audited financial statements in accordance with IFRS.⚠ Consequences of Non-Compliance: Failing to meet these conditions means losing QFZP status and being subject to the standard 9% corporate tax rate for at least five years.💡 Take Action Now: Review your business activities, ensure compliance with the new regulations, and consult with tax professionals to navigate this transition smoothly.hashtag#UAE hashtag#CorporateTax hashtag#FreeZone hashtag#BusinessStrategy hashtag#TaxCompliance hashtag#EconomicDiversification hashtag#TaxStrategy hashtag#QFZP hashtag#Brooksme

From 2009 to 2020, Espace brokers competed for some incredible prizes. Four Rolex watches in a single four month competition, boat parties, and multiple incentive trips to Las Vegas were just a few of the rewards up for grabs.Since COVID, as the Dubai property market has built strong momentum, industry incentives have ramped up once again. But while prizes and perks do play a role in motivation, they’re the easy part of the recipe and should be seen for what they are… the cherry on top.The real engine behind broker success isn’t gimmicks. It’s the strength of the platform they operate in. At Espace, everything is built around one core focus: creating a marketplace that gives brokers the highest possible chance to perform at their best and deliver exceptional revenue.While anyone can compete in the incentives game, it’s not a level playing field when it comes to the strength of the marketplace itself, and that’s where the real difference is made.hashtag#espacerealestate hashtag#dubai hashtag#mydubai hashtag#dubaibrokers hashtag#realestatedubai hashtag#dubairealestate hashtag#property hashtag#propertymarket

O Brasil tem avançado significativamente na modernização de sua infraestrutura aeroportuária. Nos últimos anos, a ampliação do modelo de concessões e os investimentos em eficiência operacional vêm transformando o setor, ampliando a conectividade regional e elevando a qualidade dos serviços prestados.Gerir aeroportos com eficiência envolve mais do que obras: requer planejamento integrado, controle rigoroso de custos, governança sólida e compromisso com metas de desempenho e sustentabilidade.É nesse contexto que a combinação entre expertise global e conhecimento local se torna essencial. Buying vs. Renting in Dubai — What’s More Profitable?The debate between buying and renting in Dubai is always on. Some say renting is flexible, others say buying is a smarter, long-term move. So, which is more profitable?Here’s the breakdown:General Thought: Why Buying Beats Renting?Renting might offer short-term convenience, but buying builds real value. You’re investing in an asset, not just paying for a place to stay.The Real Numbers: Rent vs BuyLet’s compare:Monthly Rent: AED 8,333Monthly Mortgage: AED 4,584➡ Buying is 45% cheaper than renting.Over time:Total Rent (5 years): AED 499,980Total Buy (10 years): AED 550,080➡ Renting saves a bit short-term, but you own nothing.➡ Buying builds equity, ownership, and long-term value.Conclusion: Ownership Pays OffIn markets like Dubai where prices are rising, buying means capital growth, rental income potential, and full ownership — while renting leaves you with nothing at the end.Reach out to see how buying can work for you — with real numbers, tailored to your situation!التملك أو الإيجار في دبي؟ الأرقام ما تكذب – التملك أوفر وأذكى. في سوق عقاري سريع النمو مثل دبي، التملّك لا يُعدّ مجرد خيار، بل هو خطوة استراتيجية لبناء أصول حقيقية وتحقيق عوائد مستمرة. أما الإيجار؟ فهو إنفاق شهري دون أي ملكية مستقبلية.لماذا يعتبر التملّك الخيار الأفضل ماليًا؟ لأن القسط الشهري في كثير من الحالات يكون أقل من قيمة الإيجار، ومع مرور الوقت، تصبح المِلكية كاملة لك. بالإضافة إلى إمكانية تحقيق أرباح من ارتفاع قيمة العقار أو تأجيره لاحقًا. في المقابل، الإيجار يُدفع باستمرار دون أي مردود مالي.الأرقام الحقيقية: دعونا نقارن بين الخيارين في الأرقام:الإيجار الشهري: 8,333 درهمقسط التملك الشهري: 4,584 درهم ✅ التملك يوفّر لك 45% من التكاليف الشهرية مقارنة بالإيجار.إجمالي التكاليف:الإيجار ( 5 سنوات): 499,980 درهمالتملك ( 10 سنوات): 550,080 درهم ✅ رغم أن الإيجار قد يوفّر بعض رأس المال على المدى القصير، إلا أن التملك يمنحك أصلًا حقيقيًا يبني ثروتك مع الوقت. بينما قد يكون الإيجار خيارًا مرنًا على المدى القصير، إلا أن التملك في دبي يوفر استقرارًا ماليًا طويل الأجل وقيمة استثمارية عالية.

Here’s what’s really driving the UAE’s next wave of growth:Current UAE Economic Trends & Government Initiatives:🌞 The UAE is making massive investments in renewable energy (think: Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum Solar Park), water innovation, and food security (vertical farming), all aligned with Vision 2030 and ambitious sustainability goals.🎮 Dubai is positioning itself as a global e-sports and gaming powerhouse, with dedicated free zones and major tournaments set for 2025.🌱 The National Food Security Strategy is fueling agri-tech and vertical farming, making the UAE a leader in future-ready agriculture.🤖 AI-driven healthcare, telemedicine, and medtech startups are booming, thanks to support from the Dubai Health Authority and private sector.🌊 The “blue economy”—marine tech, aquaculture, and water logistics—is a rising star, with government-backed initiatives and global partnerships.Recent News, Reports & Market Analysis:📰 UAE government agencies, Dubai Future Foundation, and top consultancies (PwC, KPMG, EY) are all highlighting these sectors as the “next big thing.”📈 Leading business media (Arabian Business, The National, Gulf Business) are spotlighting these trends in their latest coverage.What Industry Leaders Are Saying:💡 UAE-based VCs, accelerators, and business leaders on LinkedIn are calling these sectors the “hidden gems” for forward-thinking investors.The Bottom Line: While property and fintech dominate the headlines, the real opportunities in 2025 are in desert tech, e-sports, vertical farming, AI healthcare, and the blue economy. With its business-friendly policies, tax advantages, world-class infrastructure, and unwavering commitment to innovation, the city has become a 𝗵𝗲𝗱𝗴𝗲 𝗮𝗴𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘀𝘁 𝗴𝗹𝗼𝗯𝗮𝗹 𝘂𝗻𝗰𝗲𝗿𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘁𝘆. Real Estate Developers ought to recognize this seismic shift. As geopolitical and economic fluctuations reshape investment flows, they should be doubling down on 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲𝗴𝗶𝗰, 𝗳𝘂𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗲-𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗼𝗳 𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗹 𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗮𝘁𝗲 that aligns with Dubai’s trajectory as a 𝗹𝗼𝗻𝗴-𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗺 𝘄𝗲𝗮𝗹𝘁𝗵 𝗽𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗲𝗿𝘃𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗵𝘂𝗯. Here’s the recipie for how to adapt: 🔹 𝗟𝘂𝘅𝘂𝗿𝘆 & 𝗟𝗶𝗾𝘂𝗶𝗱𝗶𝘁𝘆: Focus on high-demand assets—prime residential, hospitality, and mixed-use developments—that cater to UHNWIs and institutional investors looking for 𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗴𝗶𝗯𝗹𝗲, 𝗮𝗽𝗽𝗿𝗲𝗰𝗶𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮𝘀𝘀𝗲𝘁𝘀. 🔹 𝗦𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗶𝗻𝗮𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗮𝘀 𝗦𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗱𝗮𝗿𝗱: With Dubai’s push toward net-zero and smart cities, projects should integrate ESG principles, ensuring they remain 𝗿𝗲𝘀𝗶𝗹𝗶𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗿𝗲𝗹𝗲𝘃𝗮𝗻𝘁 in a decarbonizing world. 🔹 𝗧𝗲𝗰𝗵-𝗘𝗻𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲𝗱 𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗹 𝗘𝘀𝘁𝗮𝘁𝗲: From blockchain-based transactions to AI-driven property management, developers should be thinking of leveraging tech to enhance transparency, efficiency, and investor confidence. 🔹 𝗗𝗶𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗲𝗱 𝗣𝗼𝗿𝘁𝗳𝗼𝗹𝗶𝗼𝘀: Recognizing that safe havens attract varied investor profiles, developers should be curating offerings—from 𝘆𝗶𝗲𝗹𝗱-𝗴𝗲𝗻𝗲𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗺𝗲𝗿𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝘀𝗽𝗮𝗰𝗲𝘀 to 𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗿𝗮-𝗹𝘂𝘅𝘂𝗿𝘆 𝘃𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗮𝘀—to match evolving global appetites. IPS Dubai was full of energy, innovation, and exciting real estate opportunities.As an architect who always steps into the client’s shoes, I couldn’t help but imagine how the visitor experience could have been more interactive, here is what came to mind :1. A clearer focus on what makes each project stand out would be inspiring.2. Interiors deserve as much spotlight as the beautiful façades.3. VR tech could elevate how people explore spaces.4. Pavilion layouts with more self-guided content could make discovery more intuitive—through interior models, videos, and visual storytelling.Personally, I thought Sustainable City 2.0 was a strong highlight, what I call an inspiring model for future developments.
